1. Erase es
1. Reboot agent
1. Reboot oap

Make sure both of all be set.

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/zhaoyuguang/testReport-zhaoyuguang-sc-gateway-testcase-2019-08-14-19-59.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/230/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-14-19-59.log)
This PR is ready. please do code review

> and could i ask why the nacos show there is only one instance like the picture ↑, but infacet i run three skywalking oap in my server

@Dauber01 Please make sure that all the three OAP nodes started successfully, if you start all of them in a single server, pay special attention to the buffer file path, which may conflict with each other, resulting only one that can start successfully, as for the nacos cluster implementation, I've tested again, it works as expected

```yml

receiver-trace:
  default:
    bufferPath: ${SW_RECEIVER_BUFFER_PATH:../trace-buffer2/}  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path

# ...

service-mesh:
  default:
    bufferPath: ${SW_SERVICE_MESH_BUFFER_PATH:../mesh-buffer2/}  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path

```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/63022949-98f54380-bed6-11e9-936f-70f9273b2284.png)

I test this branch in `java module` from jdk 9-12 ,tradition no module application from jdk6-12,all works well.amazing.
for the logger,I think we can use `logback` as the agent default logger instead of custom queue.
I still have concerns about binding a 3rd party logging framework. One side, too big and may be conflicts with existing system config. The other hand, such as log4j2 including disruptor too.
/run ci
MongoDB 3.2.x driver is not supported.
@flycash Any update about this VM?

and when i click the detail button ,it show like this:

the ip is 0.0.0.0

**Please make sure all of you OAP nodes start successfully, otherwise they won't register to the Nacos**

## TL;DR

> did i need to update the ip in:
> ```yml
> core:
> default:
> # Mixed: Receive agent data, Level 1 aggregate, Level 2 aggregate
> # Receiver: Receive agent data, Level 1 aggregate
> # Aggregator: Level 2 aggregate
> role: ${SW_CORE_ROLE:Mixed} # Mixed/Receiver/Aggregator
> restHost: ${SW_CORE_REST_HOST:0.0.0.0}
> restPort: ${SW_CORE_REST_PORT:12800}
> restContextPath: ${SW_CORE_REST_CONTEXT_PATH:/}
> gRPCHost: ${SW_CORE_GRPC_HOST:0.0.0.0}
> gRPCPort: ${SW_CORE_GRPC_PORT:11800}
> this config?

If you start two OAP nodes in different machine, then you don't need to modify the IP's and ports here, but if you are starting them in docker containers on the same machine and expose the ports to the host machine, it's highly possible that the ports conflicts, **PLEASE CHECK THE OAP LOG AND MAKE SURE ALL OF THEM START SUCCESSFULLY**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11767168/63067530-02f70280-bf42-11e9-8ca4-c31d07835a3a.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11767168/63067612-5d905e80-bf42-11e9-9c19-27d57024fb46.png)

No. Namespace is for isolation, not tenancy.

If you are using 0.0.0.0 for all nodes, how do you make service discovery successfully? @kezhenxu94 does nacos cluster coordinator support to set address manually? If not, docker use case may be an issue. For container, k8s coordinator is always better.
@kezhenxu94 Please make sure the milestone is set when you close issue. Otherwise, we may lose something in changelogs.

> @kezhenxu94 Please make sure the milestone is set when you close issue. Otherwise, we may lose something in changelogs.

Sorry I missed that, thanks for pointing this out 😄

@wu-sheng Does it mean that all of the cluster plugins share the same issue when using `0.0.0.0`? Such as zookeeper plugin, it also gets an address `0.0.0.0` in registry

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/63074916-2f227b80-bf62-11e9-9b80-1177144fe605.png)
When cluster running, 0.0.0.0 is not thr option today. I think that fits all service discovery. Unless coordinator supports auto IP select from VM or manually setting.

bad english,sorry.
don't need help,just want to  remind you a bug, never mind.
best wishes
Maybe , i have never read the nacos source code,and if iconfig the ip in core config ,when i use docker ,it can't start up.

@Dauber01 Yes. That is not your fault. That is what I am asking @kezhenxu94 to notice. Because as service discovery, you have to know your own IP, but when you run inside docker, it is hard to tell. So whether (a) coordinator provides some locate IP:port config, (b), you have to let the docker knows the IP:port inside.

@Dauber01 What is your container management tech stack?
k8s coordinator create by rancher
@Dauber01 Then use SkyWalking's k8s cluster manager. It is there for a long time, then you don't need to bother all these IP things :)
thank you ,i will try it

All upgrade before 6.3.0 running, the safest way is reboot agents. Or use blue-green deployment solution. Move the target service to 6.3.0 when it is OK to reboot.

After 6.3.0 agent deployed, read this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/backend-setup.md#agent-hot-reboot-trigger-mechanism-in-oap-server-upgrade
GOME. (gome.com.cn)
No further detail, closing.
@DerekHQ Check the master branch please, this should be fixed by @zhaoyuguang
I see that the response data is normal.
Only one way, reboot all your agents. You have erased the metadata, only 6.3.0+ agents support hot-auto-reboot.
You have to do some UI debug, my guess, traces break somehow, and UI can't show up.
my skywalking oap-server log also has this error.
Check Elasticsearch storage document, there are some ElasticSearch settings suggestions. And please make sure your ES cluster is powerful enough.
Does upgrade 6.3 fix this？@wu-sheng
It means client shutdown. Nothing special.
when agent start ui could not see any new data
agent send new data to collector bu ui could not see any new data
This log is not related to that. Check others and your storage.
This is not a bug fix. This is a new feature provided in 6.3.0
I have said, this is not the case.
This is not the issue too. Please search issue before submit duplicated one.
How many CPUs? Which storage? How many agent instances?
4 core cpu，all reach 100%,8g ,abount 40 agent instances,I used jstack to find that there are a lot of threads waiting in the state.
SkyWalking version? I am wondering the storage, do you use Elasticsearch cluster?
the skywalking that I used is 6.2.0 and I use Es cluster,, the machine of es is 16c32g

[Here](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent#table-of-agent-configuration-properties) are the supported properties, you can find the property to change the log path and log file name

Try 6.3.0, it will reduce some payload to OAP. But to be honest, 4c simple node OAP for 40 node agents, looks like not powerful enough. SkyWalking does aggregations inside OAP by using internal stream computing core, it is not a simple collector to receive and save.

Also, check your ES status, and our recommendations about ES bulk settings.
Update UI submodule too.

FYI @mm23504570 Besides your issue, this PR fixed the reconnection issue when Nginx responded `go away`.
What is `ip` schema? Just a literal random String? @kezhenxu94
@yanfch Any update? 6.4.0 milestone is set to release in next month by default. If you have anything to discuss and improve, I think we should start it now.

> What is `ip` schema? Just a literal random String? @kezhenxu94

`ip` schema designates which ip (or ip range) can access the nodes, but in my test, if I pre-create the nodes (say `/skywalking/remote`) and set the ACL to `ip` of my machine (in zookeeper side), and set the `enableACL` to `true` and `schema` to `ip` (in SkyWalking side), it failed to connect to zk, after changing the `enableACL` to `false`, it works, which I think is a little strange
@JaredTan95 Could you recheck this? Including ElasticSearch and MySQL storage?

I reopen a new PR  see https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3284/commits
finally it can supports all version above 2.0
moved to #3284

We use Zookeeper ACL that has 2 steps, 
1. set ACL for `zNode`.
2. authorization, like `login`.

`IP` schema, we need not `authorization` step. But I will do those steps in this pr. @kezhenxu94
I think whether we support `digest` only. Because `digest` is more widely used, and it is more clear.
How do you think? @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94
We don't support this

> At today, provide a static writer pointer may be safe for now. I am not sure about the future yet. Do you face any real issue about this?

Actually not. It is just my idea from code point.

> `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config.Logging#OUTPUT` is modifiable at runtime and the real writer may change, after your patch the modification of `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` takes no effect.
> 
> Although I think we hardly ever change the `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` at runtime, but the unit tests do this in order to verify, so I think you should either modify the unit test accordingly, or keep everthing unchanged, WDYT @wu-sheng

@kezhenxu94 I see.  But why we change the output type at runtime? is there a real scene?

> > `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config.Logging#OUTPUT` is modifiable at runtime and the real writer may change, after your patch the modification of `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` takes no effect.
> > Although I think we hardly ever change the `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` at runtime, but the unit tests do this in order to verify, so I think you should either modify the unit test accordingly, or keep everthing unchanged, WDYT @wu-sheng
> 
> @kezhenxu94 I see. But why we change the output type at runtime? is there a real scene?

I think the answer is NO, but you have to make the CI pass at least, it changes the output type at runtime, just for verification :)
